thread.title: ‘Putin’s not on our team’: President Obama, Dems & media weigh in on Russian hacking story
thread.title_full: ‘Putin’s not on our team’: President Obama, Dems & media weigh in on Russian hacking story

author: William A.
title: ‘Putin’s not on our team’: President Obama, Dems & media weigh in on Russian hacking story
text:
‘Putin’s not on our team’: President Obama, Dems & media weigh in on Russian hacking story Posted at 9:11 pm on January 6, 2017 by William A. 
President Barack Obama spoke Friday night to ABC News, and the interview covered the Russian hacking story. 
Here is part of his interview with George Stephanopoulos: 

— This Week (@ThisWeekABC) January 7, 2017 . @potus tells ABC he's "concerned" over GOP Putin confidence:"We have to remind ourselves we’re on the same team. ..Putin’s not on our team" 
— Justin Sink (@justinsink) January 7, 2017 Obama says Russian President Vladimir Putin should not be trusted https://t.co/TMAvic6NOh pic.twitter.com/zT18XOS9Pb 
— CNN International (@cnni) January 7, 2017 
The Russian hacking story was also a concern of other Democrats, media, and liberals on Twitter: Today's @ODNIgov report clearly explains unprecedented Russian attack on our democracy during the 2016 election. https://t.co/5cBVu8RyxN 
— Betty McCollum (@BettyMcCollum04) January 7, 2017 . @SenatorBaldwin says concerns over Russian influence in Washington runs well beyond hacking. #WKOW https://t.co/R2rLQ0OWjY 
— Greg Neumann (@gneumann_wkow) January 7, 2017 Our elections should be decided by American citizens, not foreign hackers, heads of state… My full statement: https://t.co/lDy4HzJOkX 
— Senator Jack Reed (@SenJackReed) January 6, 2017 Read my statement on the release of our intel community’s assessment of Russia’s cyberattack on the election here: https://t.co/pw7U9KWVEr pic.twitter.com/71dQAx3t2R 
— Senator Dick Durbin (@SenatorDurbin) January 6, 2017 . @RepAdamSchiff : “Dumping of damaging material” consequential to Clinton, helped Trump https://t.co/99qIDqZFK9 https://t.co/bAyx8rT401 
— Jim Sciutto (@jimsciutto) January 6, 2017 That big 3 column headline on the front of the NYT… a stomach-churning moment in history. https://t.co/DLT3UjRaDA pic.twitter.com/QH6ZI6obAE 
— Rachel Maddow MSNBC (@maddow) January 7, 2017 Right now on All In #inners https://t.co/MaLGv5o2lP 
— All In w/Chris Hayes (@allinwithchris) January 7, 2017 Declassified report says Putin ‘ordered’ effort to undermine faith in election and help elect Trump https://t.co/akQitFFyzG 
— Washington Post (@washingtonpost) January 6, 2017 Breaking News: Trump, after an intelligence briefing, conceded that Russia could be a culprit in the D.N.C. hack https://t.co/LeWzYSnzbC 
— The New York Times (@nytimes) January 6, 2017 
The House Foreign Affairs Committee had this tweet Friday night: There is nothing to suggest Russian meddling impacted our voting and tallying process in any way https://t.co/Ka6GWqbCIr
